title: Manchester City issue injury update on Benjamin Mendy ahead of Wolves clash
text:
Benjamin Mendy has suffered a hamstring injury on his comeback from a knee injury (Picture: Getty)

Manchester City have confirmed that Benjamin Mendy has suffered a fresh setback in his comeback from a long-term knee injury ahead of their Premier League clash against Wolves.

The 25-year-old’s time in England has been plagued by injury problems as he has missed 87 matches due to two serious knee injuries and a host of other more minor issues.

Mendy has gradually been re-integrated back into the City side this season, featuring four times in all competitions for a combined total of 172 minutes.

That included a full 90 minutes during Tuesday’s 2-0 victory over Dinamo Zagreb in the Champions League, however, the club have revealed he has since sustained a hamstring injury.

A City statement read: ‘Benjamin Mendy misses today’s game after sustaining an injury to his left hamstring.

‘The French full-back is expected to return to action following the international break.’

Mendy has been plagued with injury problems during his time with Manchester City (Picture: Getty)

Despite having Oleksandr Zinchenko and summer signing from PSV Angelino available, Pep Guardiola has opted to start Portuguese right-back Joao Cancelo on the left against Wolves.

Mendy isn’t the only first-team absentee for the visit of Nuno’s side with influential playmaker Kevin De Bruyne also sidelined due to a groin injury picked up last weekend against Everton.

As with Mendy, City expect the Belgium international to return to action following the upcoming international break.
